The Green Sea Floyds Middle & High School Beta Club competed in the Virtual National Convention and placed in the top 10 in two competition events. Lindsey Rhodes, who was assisted by her sister Lexis Rhodes, took first place in the Portfolio Competition at the junior level. The Portfolio Competition allows each club to submit one portfolio that showcases the club’s experiences over the past year. This is a way to record each Beta Club's service, membership, and activities for the school year, and the time between conventions. This competition is designed to encourage club pride, creativity and innovation, interpretation of the theme, and artistic design.

Hugh Strickland took fifth place in the 9th grade Math competition at the senior level.

A big thank you goes out to the school’s Beta Club sponsors, Ms. Leslie Hewitt and Ms. Wendy Tyree.

Join HCS in celebrating National School Nurse Day! With 75 school nurses, HCS is one of only a few districts in the state that provides a full-time nurse at each school. Throughout the year, school nurses provide preventative, routine, and primary care services to more than 45,000 students.
During the statewide closure of schools due to COVID-19, our school nurses have continued to care for our communities by screening district staff who are providing services to students, by helping to support the South Carolina Department of Health and Environmental Control, and by joining the front lines with our healthcare community during the largest global pandemic in over 100 years.

The Census Bureau will NEVER ask for:
• Your Social Security number.
• Your bank account or credit card numbers.
• Money or donations.
Reporting Suspected Fraud
If you suspect fraud, call 800-923-8282 to speak with a local Census Bureau representative. If it is determined that the visitor who came to your door does not work for the Census Bureau, contact your local police department.

Horry County Board of Education Member Janet P. Graham was recognized at the South Carolina School Boards Association 2020 Annual Convention for achieving Level 6, the highest level of recognition in its Boardmanship Institute.

The South Carolina School Boards Association's Boardmanship Institute offers a year-round training curriculum focused on leadership skills for board members on state and national educational issues. Board members are recognized for reaching each of six levels. Level 6 acknowledges the many hours of training board members receive to gain the knowledge and skills to assist them as leaders in making decisions for the benefit of children in public schools.

Mrs. Graham has been serving on the Horry County Board of Education since September 2012. She represents District 7, which includes portions of Conway and Carolina Forest.

Pictured left to right: Chuck Saylors, SCSBA President, Janet P. Graham, Horry County Board of Education - District 7, and Scott T.Price, SCSBA Executive Director.

City of Conway, SC
December 4, 2019 at 9:27 AM ·

In Monday night's Conway City Council meeting, Mayor Barbara Blain-Bellamy recognized Brooklyn Ruggerio as the artist of the 2019 City of Conway Christmas Card! Each year, the City of Conway holds a contest where Conway students are asked to submit their drawings for the cover of the City's Christmas card. This year, Brooklyn's drawing was chosen out of hundreds of others that were submitted. Congratulations, Brooklyn!

post_text: Did you know December 9-13 is Computer Science Education Week all across the nation? Anyone from children to adults can learn how to write code.
